title: 112_hr6427
content: The Act may be cited as the "Capitalizing Workforce Development Act of 2012" and includes a Job Training Resources Grant Program. The "Capitalizing Workforce Development Act of 2012" includes a Job Training Resources Grant Program that provides funds for grants to support job training programs. Eligible applicants can receive grants for purchasing, renovating, constructing, or leasing real property for qualified self-sustaining job programs. The Job Training Resources Grant Program provides funds for job training programs to individuals with employment challenges. Federal funds are not required for programmatic or administrative expenses, except for specific expenses. Applicants can participate in other Federal programs. Priority is given to applicants with successful experience in establishing qualified self-sustaining job programs. The Job Training Resources Grant Program prioritizes applicants with successful experience in establishing self-sustaining job programs for individuals with employment challenges. Eligible applicants include national organizations providing employment-related services to individuals with employment barriers. The Job Training Resources Grant Program prioritizes applicants with successful experience in establishing self-sustaining job programs for individuals with employment challenges. Grants are conditioned upon the establishment of job placement performance goals for each program receiving funds. The Job Training Resources Grant Program prioritizes applicants with successful experience in establishing self-sustaining job programs for individuals with employment challenges. Grants are conditioned upon the establishment of job placement performance goals for each program receiving funds, including the performance assessment dates for goal achievement set by the Secretary. The Secretary must also ensure the protection of the Federal Government's interest in any real property purchased, renovated, constructed, or improved using grant funds. The Job Training Resources Grant Program allocates $200,000,000 for grants in fiscal year 2013 to support self-sustaining job programs. Recipients must distribute funds to local organizations for program implementation. Section 409(a) of the Social Security Act outlines recapture penalties. Section 409(a) of the Social Security Act introduces a penalty for recipients of funds under the Job Training Resources Grant Program who fail to meet job placement goals. Repayment to the Treasury is required in proportion to the degree of failure. The penalty for failing to meet job placement goals under the Job Training Resources Grant Program involves repayment to the Treasury over a 10-year period without accruing interest. Recipients can choose to comply with performance goals instead of making payments, subject to the Secretary's approval. States facing penalties can also opt for compliance instead of payments. In lieu of required payments, the Secretary may reduce the grant payable to the State under section 403(a)(1) over a 10-fiscal-year period. State penalty limitations do not apply to penalties under this paragraph, except for penalties with reductions made under subparagraph (D). Section 409(b)(2) of the Social Security Act is amended to include penalty exclusion under (17). [SEC. 3. OFFSET TO ENSURE PAYGO COMPLIANCE.] - This section discusses measures to ensure compliance with Pay-As-You-Go requirements.
